availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Phillip Claiborne Eubank Sr. (Clark County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Emily Winborn Eubank in Madison County, Kentucky, on July 4, 1838. Father of John A. Eubank, William Eubank, Christopher Eubank. Phillip C. Eubank Jr., Elizabeth Jane Eubank, Stephanie M. Eubank, Temple B. Eubank, and Roderick Eubank. Married Susan J. Mapel Eubank in Estill County, Kentucky, on March 16, 1858. Father of Grant Eubank. Farmer in Clark County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Clark County in 1850. Farmer in Clark County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Clark County in 1860. Employed David C. Winborn and James Lackey as day laborers in Clark County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
